title: Great Indian Food at Dhaka
text: Nice place for an Indian good in Dhaka. Though in Dhaka I always prefer Bangladesi food, but for some taste of Naan or Paneer Tikka masala, this place is a must. Nicely decorated and very professional staff.

title: Great Hotel. As usual
text:
RB is a great hotel chain and it's CTG property is no exception. Good staff, good food bla bla bla. This facility was inaugurated by the PM Sk Hasina.
Room decor was good. One would get a great city view from the restaurant at 20th floor.

title: What A Great Beach
text: Calangute has changed in last 3 years. It was neat and clean. In the evening the place was amazing, one can stay here in any of the shacks for hours. Thanks to the Government for maintaining Calangute so well.

title: One Needs to be Careful and must bargain Hard
text: Prices are higher, so one needs to be careful. No point in buying Silver jewelry from road side shops. Sometimes they don't show much interest for indian buyers, as Indians do hard bargain. Comparatively they prefer Europeans, whom they can fool easily. A Lion faced lock, which was priced at Rs.1500 was finally given to me at Rs.750. Quoting prices with such high margin is not a good biz practice. More importantly, these are not products from Tibet, but mostly from Nepal and Ladakh.

title: Taxi stand behind Tibet Market
text: Quality Taxis, but Goa taxi rates are always high. Only thing is that you get quality service. Drivers are normally friendly.

title: The Place known for Panipuri, Chat Masala etc
text: This place always used to be crowded for Panipuri and Chat Masala. This time is no exception. But they have vacated the place just outside on the road side. Not sure why.

title: Good Place to be here
text: It was 2 minutes walk from Ticlo hotel, where we stayed. It was a good place to visit and we enjoyed it.

title: My Fav place in Goa, but need improvement
text:
I have stayed in this place 5 times in last 10 years. Biggest plus is Location, right on Calangute - Baga road.
But I will suggest few improvements, if they really care for their guests.
1. No complimentary water. Water was made available at 50% higher price, which is illegal ans someone can take them to court.
2. Breakfast need better spread.
3. They can maintain own fleet of taxis for Airport drop and pick up, though Taxis were easily available just outside the hotel.
Nevertheless, will stay here again.

title: The best mall in Navi Mumbai
text: It is undoubtedly the best mall in Navi Mumbai, unfortunately without a Movie theatre. All big brands are available here. Another plus is this place is within 2 minutes walk from my home.

title: Superb Chicken Matka Biryani
text:
Ordered Chicken Matka Biryani thru Zomato. Taste was just awesome. Far than many other Biryani available in the locality.
A must have.

title: Too crowded now
text: Massive population explosion in the country has virtually made it difficult to visit this place. During high tide tourists have to wait for upto 2 hours to get offloaded at the fort. One must plan properly with prior info on high and low tide.

title: Best location in Murud
text:
Undoubtedly the best resort in Murud. Great food, great humble staff. Great accomodation.
Though i have given 5 stars, they should consider following.
1. Check in and out time can be revised to 2 pm and 12 pm respectively.
2. Must add some fish fish in buffet. They provide only Chicken and egg .
3. Ala carte fish was very expensive. Need to be priced reasonably.
4. Sweet dish need improvement.

A must visit.

title: A must in Amsterdam
text: AMS has more Canals than Roads. So a Canal trip is a must. It costs about Euro 12 for an hour trip. Evening trips also available with Dinner.

title: Hotel Location is Good, but Need better maintenance
text: The Location is good, within walking distance from Fort. But Hotel has a very poor look, even though rooms are big and not that bad. Better Packaging needed. Apparently many group tour people come here for cooking food, which resulted in to such look.

title: Mighty Gates, One is not visible from other one
text: As per the normal defense mechanism, a fort gate should not be visible from outside, but only from a difficult angle; and inside the fort, one gate cannot be seen from another gate, so as to confuse the attacker. This gate is no exception.

title: The White Castle of Thessaloniki
text: Right on the sea front is this beautiful White Castle. A nice place for some photography and family outing.

title: 1896 Olympic was organized here
text: I saw this place just for few minutes while on my way to the airport. This is a Tourist attraction now. The first Olympic game in 1896 was organized here.

title: Acropolis more famous than Greece itself
text: Greek civilization is one of the 5 ancient civilizations on earth (others are - Egyptian, Indian, Roman & Inka/Maya Civilization). This place is therefore a must see and cannot be missed.

title: Superb
text:
An amazing place. Amazing people. Amazing break fast.
This was my first trip to Athens and the hotel was booked by my business partner. Since he visits this place frequently, he was well known to people here, so got even better treatment. But even otherwise this hotel group is my all time fav.

title: A serious Beer museum indeed
text: I had the opportunity to visit this place with my local friends. Food was really good, particularly fish. The museum is in the first floor and a must see.

title: Main Tourist Attraction in Lisbon
text: Life of Lisbon revolves around this place. Near the sea, this is the end of Europe. Historical buildings, Statues, Restaurants (including Ronaldo's CR7 Resto). A must visit. In a recent Bollywood Movie (War - Starring Hrithik Roshan and Tiger Shroff), this place was shown very nicely.

title: Excellent Property, Excellent Break Fast
text:
I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, and it was an amazing experience. Break fast spread was good, Staff were really helpful. I had some confusion with my onward journey to Porto, so they were very flexible and accommodated my request.
Very close to the City Center. One can simply hire a tuk-tuk and plan a city tour from here.

title: Superb North Indian Food
text:
Had a great lunch today. Dishes were just too good, both Chicken and Mutton. Even Naan was very soft and different than most of other restaurants. Sweet line soda was tastier than other places.
A must visit.

title: Landmark of BKC
text: Good good, good ambience, albiet noisy at times. Staff are well trained, professional. Good place to be there.

title: Chembur Outlet is a Franchisee and the place could have been better
text:
I gave it 4 star because the dishes we got - Tel Koi and Ilish Barisali was tasty. Prices were reasonable, nothing to complain.
That's it.
Specials items are not prepared daily, so did not get some target dishes. Ambiance was terrible.
On further investigation I came to know this branch is a Franchisee, but materials supplied by Bhojo Hori Manna only.

title: Mumbai's iconic Monument, a must visit
text: Being a Mumbaikar I get a chance to see this museum frequently. And everytime it gives me immense pleasure. Such a gate just for receiving a king shows the clout of British empire in those days.

title: Good Biryani, but improvement possible
text:
Superb experience with their Biryani, though i thought they could use less oil. Staff were really good, checking with customer at frequent interval. Deserts were limited.
The access road was not good, they can probably tie up with other shops and push BMC for doing the road work properly. If you are a food lover this place is for you.

title: Good place for a quick bite
text: Small place but very nice. Inside one can see under trees. South Indian dishes are also available. Overall good experience

title: Worst Lounge ever
text: Nothing can be worse than this. Food here is just for token. Service quality poorest if the poor, even the lounge at domestic terminal is better than this. Can the authorities seriously look in to this and suspend the existing operator?

title: A good place for some quick snacks
text: We went their for a quick lunch and this place did not disappoint us. The chickn clear soup was good.

title: Good food
text:
We reached here at 8 pm. It was crowded. Two groups were already partying. Once they left it was much more comfortable. They serve Indian food and many Indians flock here alongwith local Bengalies. Mutton biryani was good, do was palak paneer.
A must visit in dhaka

title: Need further improvement
text:
I had gone last year and i liked their Kachi biryani. This time i packed for home. They did a good packaging but quality was nit that great. Need improvement.
Will give it one more try.
This time chicken kachi biryani was not available. Any reason?

title: Same standard everywhere
text: It has maintained same standard in India and Bangladesh. I have visited almost 8 of their restaurants in India and their Dhaka outlet was equally good. Pan fried fish chili was my all time favourite.

title: Crowded even at minus 4 degree
text: Tourists flocked here at 10 pm with temperature below minus 4 degree C. During the day it was even more crowded. Central station is just 5 mins walk from here and one can roam around the city with this square as the nucleus.

title: The old world charm
text: This station has that old world charm like many other stations in Europe and Asia from the Victorian age.

title: Great place to stay in AMS
text: We stayed here for 5 nights as part of a group. Experience was good. Good breakfast, just opposite to Hardrock cafe and all major attractions within walking distance. Will surely stay here again. Staff were really friendly and rooms were of good size.

title: Great experience
text:
We had gone for full 3 hours cruise with dinner at evening. Initially we enjoyed but later started feeling bored. It was certainly not their fault.
Food was just okay type.
Day time 1 hour cruise is available at euro 12. They will try to sell few more things, but don't buy them.

title: Good Restaurant but memories of real India was missing
text: Call it localisation or anything you like, taste was certainly different from what we get in India. But afterall it was Indian food and that's it.

title: Always House Full
text: Big lounges, always houseful. People are moving out and moving in, never saw a more live lounge anywhere. Good good.

title: Just ok ok type. Nothing great
text: Just opposite to Park Central this is a shadow of other hardrock cafes. Too ordinary without the real charm.

title: Authentic Indian taste was missing
text: We had good good here as we were hungry, but honestly the Indian authenticity was missing. Need to improve on desserts.

title: What's so great?
text: Only a walking in the evening is not a bad idea. But what's so great about this place? I think every city has such places, but Amsterdam has probably glorified this place a little louder.

title: Leader in Cheese
text: They have a store in Amsterdam in every 100 meters, i guess. Looks to be reputed brand there, even as i am not a connosoure of cheese. Many varieties are available at different price range.

title: Good good, but need some more variety
text: This place is adjacent to Hotel Gallary and serves good food. Ambience is superb. But i would like to see them serving some Arabic and Turkish food as well. Also need to have an English menu.

title: My all time favourite
text: Reasonable price, good food, friendly. I have visited this place over 10 times in last 4 years, and i have no complaints.

title: Great experience
text: This was my fourth trip to Tambov and i had the chance to stay here for first time. On earlier occasions it was under maintenance, it seems. Very nice hotel, good breakfast at cafe Veranda. But most importantly they always had an English speaking person at the reception. Even a lady from housekeeping team was good at English.

title: Good place for some Indian Food
text: It was a group of Indians, Pakistanis and Bangladeshis and we wanted some food of our own Taste. We stormed in to this place, about 15 of us. The Hotel was good enough to accommodate us and arrange food within half an hour. We were hungry after long flights, so yes, we felt the food was tasty. The food was actually good and we returned as satisfied and grateful.

title: Good location, Good Staff, good food
text: I stayed there for 5 nights and it was a great experience. Location was good, near the commercial area of Gulshan, Uttara; staff was good, and great spread in breakfast. They have few restaurants including an indian one with live music with hindi and Bengali songs.

title: Superb Sorse Ilish
text: We had choosen Sorse Ilish Thali, and it was just superb. I did not know about Kolkata brand earlier, will try later. But it's Dhaka Avatar was truly great. Need to work on deserts. Bengali sweets were missing.

title: Amazing Experience, Will come back again
text:
It was an action packed 16 hours. We reached at 5 PM in the evening and left at 9 am in the next morning. in between we had - High tea, Camel Safari, local Cultural function, Dinner, then in the next morning Jeep Safari and break fast. Everything was so entertaining.
The place is much inside and very close to a dune.
Only regret was it was still hot during Diwali. So while we are determined to come again, we will choose either Dec or Jan for getting a taste of Desert Cold.

title: A Haveli more than a palace
text: This haveli was constructed by a opium trader who amassed huge wealth from his trade. Richer than the king he used to lend money to the kings. But after India wins freedom his fortune left him and he had to sell this property to Kothari for just Rs.85,000, about 1200 dollar. A palace with all luxury available Patwas lived a royal life indeed. What really surprised me is the kerocene operated refrigerator, to name just one luxury item in those time. A must see.

title: Once the source of Jaisalmer drinking water, deserves to be a tourist spot
text: The lake is huge, with a massive gate for entrace a must see at Jaisalmer. A good place for boating etc, but authorities should protect this lake from such polluting misuse. Some shops nearby are good.

title: Good Bengali Food Available here
text:
We did not stay here, but the hotel is located near Hanuman Circle and within walking distance from Major Attractions. So we may stay here in future if revisit Jaisalmer.
We went there twice for Bengali good. Normal thali, the basics were for Rs.130.

title: Truly an archaeological splendor
text: Whatever be the reason for people abandoning village, this place reminds us of the old architect of common man's residence. The roofing system was mainly interesting to watch.

title: Resting place for Jaisalmer Royals
text: Small to Medium size tomb of Jaisalmer Royals. The place needs better maintenance. As per the system, the tomb of a King will be constructed by his grandson during marriage. Few tombs we found where living queens of dead kings were virtually killed in the same funeral pyre. Such a bad system was stopped only in 1829 when anti Satidaha act was passed by Lord William Bentink, then Governor of India on the insistence of social reformer Raja Rammohan Roy.

title: Sonar Mandir
text: If Jaisalmer fort is Sonar Kella, these temples are Sonar Mandir. Superb Jain Architect. A must see during Jaisalmer trip.

title: Superb Food, Superb Hospitality
text: I booked this hotel thru Royal adventure group in Jaipur. Very nice hotel, well trained staff as always. But what i really like about them is their food, though we only had one lunch in their hotel. Break fast was with very good spread.

title: Finally I made it to the "Sonar Kella", A dream came true.
text:
I had seen Satyajit Ray's Sonar Kella (the Golden Fort) for the 1st time in 1980. But finally i got a chance to visit this place on 27 Oct 2019. A great feeling, and I was not disappointed at all (as opined by some reviewer). The Fort is the only live fort in India where 5000 people still live, so please don't complaint about it being too crowded. Excellent structure, made of Yellow lime stone, which brought a Golden touch to this city. A good place to buy some souvenir, and of course a stone bowl or pathor bati.
But sorry, I did not buy the golden bowl, but bought something else. In a museum inside the fort, i learned about Red Limestone from Habur village which is situated about 50 Kms from the city. Apparently a bowl or glass made from such stone has the property to convert milk in to card without any fermentation. These stones were formed about 180 Million years ago, and has two varieties, - Wood fossil and sea fossil. sea fossil is more expensive and a glass costed me a little over 50 dollar. It also has other medical values of curing high BP, Sugar etc. I am now in the process of doing the Experiment.
A must see fort for any history lovers.

title: For an authentic Jodhpur , stay here
text:
I stayed here for a night and really enjoyed it. The fort is just 15 mins walk thru narrow bulane.
Connecting lanes are very narrow and extremely dirty, that too during Diwali. It's a shame for the Municipality. Can't blame the hotel. The place is inhabited by Brahmins, so you will not get Onion Kachouri, in the nearby sweet shops. This was explained by a local shop keeper. Autos on road are too noisy, all old models and highly polluting.
Food in the hotel was good. Makes sense to stay here.

title: Climbing the mountain is much easier now
text:
One can use the ropeway to reach this place. Cost is only Rs. 127 for up and down journey. Else it would have been really difficult for people to reach this temple.
A must visit

title: World's only Bramha temple is a must see
text: This is not a tourist place, but a must visit for Hindus, being the only Bramha temple on earth. Only 5 mins work from Pushkar, the pond.

title: A religious journey
text: This was my second trip to Pushkar after a gap of almost 12 years. The place has not changed much and holds to its old world charm. The guide explained the myth about Bramha, Savitri and Gayatri. A must visit for every Hindu and for those who respect India's glorious past.

title: Has all basic facilities, Good staff
text:
I stayed here for a day and really liked the place and people. Very friendly.
But few improvements are needed. The restaurant can be better. This hotel does not take credit card, this can be really embarrassing at times.

title: Well maintained but without many collection
text: It is know as the newest royal palace in India, opened up only in 1946. The palace was built at a cost of Rs. 95 lakhs. Very well managed by the royals. But collections were not great, may be due to most of historical collections are at the Mehnargarh fort. Good to see the royal vintage car collections.

title: Great monument from a Golden era
text: The fort is on the top of the mountain and is visible from most part of the city. It is also visible from the flight once it lands at the airport. One can take a lift while going up and then come down while looking at things. This will cost Rs. 50 per head. Entry fee Rs. 120 per head, but for senior citizens it is Rs. 60 with proof.

title: My all time favourite - great set up at Jodhpur
text: Radisson hotel is my all time favourite and i have stayed in their 8 properties so far. It did not disappoint me. Great location, great staff around, great hospitality, great rooms, and finally great food.

title: A site for Volcanic Rock Formation - Also known as Monk Valley
text: Another site within Cappadocia with Volcanic Rock formation. In Devrant valley all the rocks look like Animals (a camel is quite popular). Here these rocks look like tall mushrooms.

title: We were Superb Hungry and We liked their Food
text: We reached late and had limited choice. Bread, Lentil Soup and Water Melon. I was a Vegetarian by choice on that day, so somehow managed....

title: My First Visit to a Mosque was A Wonderful Experience
text: Konya was our second stop after Capadocia during our group tour to Turkey. This Mosque cum Museum gave a wonderful experience, as our Guide (a Germany Born Turkish) explained various places inside the museum. Very peaceful place and well managed one.

title: A must see in Prayagraj
text: A very rare temple of Hanuman Ji, he is not sitting but lying on the floor. A must visit. This place is just outside Allahabad fort and two minutes from the river bank.

title: Walking down the History Street
text: This is the main road within Ephesus. A great feel to walk here. Who else have walked through this lane through centuries? And who will walk here in the centuries to come? Very well maintained monument, a must for history lovers.

title: Good collection of Turkish Pottery
text: It was our first stop at Capadocia. They demonstrated about pottery making and how the colouring is done. Very good Inventory, over price was relatively higher, though certain items were priceless.

title: Blue or turquoise?
text: Historically Turkey was associated with a colour which is a combination of Blue and green and a new colour Turquoise was created, though turkey knew about other colours as well. This colour is thus hugely popular in Turkey thru centuries. This mosque is visited by people of all faith and a major tourist attraction in Istanbul

title: Witness of Ottoman Wealth and Glory
text: The palace is right on the bank of Bosphorus and a silent testimony to the wealth and luxury of Ottoman rulers. A must see in Istanbul

title: Excellent place, well maintained, historical
text: We just had a brief time in this place. Overwhelmingly beautiful, well managed. Very close to all other places of attraction.

title: Average performance, but still recommended...
text: Not the greatest of things that i have seen, but i will still, recommend it mainly for two reasons, 1) a mail dancer who was superb and 2) the flexibility. We were only two groups that day, one from India and another from china. since we reached early, they started the show early. At the end our group took charge of this place and danced with hit Bollywood songs.

title: A great Amphitheater. This can accommodate 25000 people
text: The Amphitheater may not be in a great shape, but a monument which carries 2000 years of history is worth a visit. We heard even now this place is used for various concerts.

title: An Archaeological Wonder
text: More than 2000 years old. Yet the Front side is still intact. Strong work of While Marble. The rear portion was not so strong unfortunately.
